POST
Step 1 - Get oAuth Credentials
{{Host}}/oauth/token?grant_type=client_credentials&client_id={{ClientID}}&client_secret={{ClientSecret}}
This API endpoint is used to obtain an access token for client authentication. It is an HTTP POST request that is sent to the /oauth/token endpoint with the required parameters.

To make a successful request, you need to provide the following parameters in the request URL:

grant_type: The type of grant being requested. In this case, it should be set to client_credentials.
client_id: The client ID of the application making the request. This is a required parameter.
client_secret: The client secret associated with the client ID. This is also a required parameter.
Once the request is made, the server will validate the client credentials and return a response with the access token.

The response will contain the following information:

access_token: The access token that can be used to authenticate subsequent requests.
token_type: The type of token returned. In this case, it will be Bearer.
expires_in: The expiration time of the access token in seconds.
scope: The scope of the access token, indicating the permissions granted to the client.
Please note that the client credentials should be kept secure and not shared with unauthorized parties.

Example Request:

Plain Text
POST {{Host}}/oauth/token?grant_type=client_credentials&client_id={{ClientID}}&client_secret={{ClientSecret}}
Example Response:

Plain Text
{
  "access_token": "{{vault:json-web-token}}",
  "token_type": "Bearer",
  "expires_in": 3600,
  "scope": "read write"
}
